alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 20 at 2:04AM MDT until August 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY BETWEEN NOON AND 8 PM TODAY FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .A very anomalous hot, dry and windy pattern is on tap for today. Very dry air, especially for mid to late August, remains in place of much of northern and central New Mexico. Additionally, as New Mexico is sandwiched between a stout upper high over the Great Plains and a tropical system headed for California, unusually strong southeasterly winds will develop by late morning and continue through early evening. This will result in critical fire weather conditions for several hours across the Northwest Plateau and Middle Rio Grande Valley, to include the Albuquerque Metro area. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM MDT this evening. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northwest Plateau (Zone 101) and the Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) between noon and 8 PM today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southeast at 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 10 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Plateau
